title: Why is polygamy banned in Islam when the creator himself had multiple wives at some point? - Quora

response.answer_text: Who on Earth told you that it’s banned? Nothing’s banned in Islam unless Allah says so. The Qur’an allows polygyny as long as the husband can treat them (up to 4 wives) equally; if he has even the slightest doubt that he can’t, it is forbidden for him. Polyandry is not and never has been allowed in Islam. The creator has no wives. Allah has no wives or children.
Polygamy isn’t banned at all in Islam. In fact, Muslim men are allowed to have up to four wives. Of course it’s not the other way around: Muslim women can only have one husband. So much for equality.
